item.description:
The Official Boston Symphony Orchestra Meetup Group kindly welcoming Euro meetup to enjoy fine music in a spectacular setting, Berkshire county.

The FCM Fromm Concert at Tanglewood

"Tanglewood season features Stefan Asbury leading TMC players in a program of two spectacular pieces of contemporary music by two composers close to the Tanglewood family, John Harbison ("A Full Moon in March") and Ollie Knussen ("Where the Wild Things Are"). Let me know if you'd like to sit on the Ozawa Hall lawn as a group or sit inside the Hall. If you'd like to go inside I'll look into getting us a block of tickets. I'll create a spot for us with some blankets at 6:30pm for anyone who wants to stop by early and have dinner, and if folks would like to pitch in I'd be more than happy to pick up some food and wine. Very much looking forward to seeing all of you! Anyone who can join me this early is welcome to. Hope you all can make it.

Best,
Matt"
- organizer of BSO meetup.

http://www.bso.org/bs...

Details on tickets later, you can become a member of BSO meetup, and communicate with Matt directly, or send me questions, wishes.
Car pool anyone?
I ll have 2 sits available. will drive early morning to Berkshire, back after concert.

Maia
781-718-6203

Tanglewood is an estate and music venue located in Lenox and Stockbridge, Massachusetts. It has been the Boston Symphony Orchestra's summer home since 1937. The name Tanglewood comes from the book "Tanglewood Tales" by American author Nathaniel Hawthorne. Hawthorne wrote the book while living in a cottage in Lenox in the early 1850's. The name was taken on by a nearby estate which was eventually donated to the Boston Symphony Orchestra.
http://www.whalesandw...

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: Magical Tanglewood
